questions.question: Example single-answer question: What is the primary purpose of a project charter?
options: To formally authorize the project and provide the project manager with authority
questions.explanation: The project charter formally authorizes the project and provides the project manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities. While it may contain budget information and stakeholder lists, its primary purpose is authorization.

questions.question: Example multiple-answer question: Which of the following are benefits of using an iterative development approach? (Select all that apply)
options: Ability to adapt to changing requirements
Lower overall project costs in all cases
questions.explanation: Iterative development provides faster feedback from stakeholders and enables the team to adapt to changing requirements. However, it does not reduce the need for testing (testing is still crucial in each iteration), and it doesn't guarantee lower costs in all cases.

questions.question: What is the difference between a risk and an issue?
options: There is no difference, they are the same thing
A risk is an uncertain event that may occur in the future; an issue is a problem that currently exists
An issue is more severe than a risk
Risks are documented in the issue log
questions.explanation: A risk is an uncertain event or condition that, if it occurs, has a positive or negative effect on project objectives. An issue is a current condition or problem that is already affecting the project and requires immediate attention.

questions.question: Which of the following are characteristics of servant leadership? (Select all that apply)
options: Focuses on the growth and well-being of team members
questions.explanation: Servant leadership focuses on the growth and well-being of team members and communities. Servant leaders help remove impediments and barriers for the team. They do not make decisions independently or use command-and-control approaches.
